document.title: Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Health Education - Kindergarten

EF976893D6704463B616D91D44B0B0D7.description: describe appropriate actions to take in response to bullying.

104059F628CD4DBCAD681751746469EE.description: demonstrate how to get help from a teacher, parent, or trusted adult in solving problems and conflicts with peers; and

450D4E9BFC9549259249543053BF5937.description: identify replacement behaviors to avoid bullying friends, family members, and peers;

3F7FF877EE8D40A093542A145DB5B28D.description: The student understands that bullying behaviors result in unhealthy conditions throughout the life span. The student is expected to:

FD19D7AA5B96438E8C834691012A79DC.description: demonstrate skills for making new acquaintances.

B4E2175D236A4DBB9E7C26FBC32B0EBB.description: identify and use refusal skills to avoid unsafe behavior situations such as saying no in unsafe situations and then telling an adult if he/she is threatened; and

69AC8C37C844467B9CE92CEAD721B4DD.description: The student comprehends the skills necessary for building and maintaining healthy relationships. The student is expected to:

4A4E48D1384D495184D46CE3659520A3.description: recognize and explain the importance of manners and rules for healthy communication and treating others with respect.

7F3148DAEDC348DD976CC0D3EF113865.description: explain the importance of showing consideration and respect for teachers, family members, friends, peers, and other individuals; and

01425670A49E4879A419AC2AA8D52092.description: recognize and describe individual differences and communicate appropriately and respectfully with all individuals;

5D369131AADC4E8F81CBB4145ED1BF94.description: The student understands ways to communicate consideration and respect for self, family, friends, and others. The student is expected to:

53F0BAF3201F48589831399B024AC5CF.description: identify ways to prevent the transmission of head lice such as sharing brushes and caps.

E0345C8B49F64D13BE300B9C6E338E74.description: tell how weather affects individual health such as dressing for warmth, protecting skin from the sun, and keeping classrooms and homes warm and cool; and

29278C7BAD7548479A55DE91DD708222.description: The student understands that various factors influence personal health. The student is expected to:

600B9BB0907446DCB3C7638F348182D6.description: discuss basic parts of the body's defense system against germs such as the skin.

B9A6E27B84524BFC85DB8E92BBFB7806.description: explain practices used to control the spread of germs such as washing hands; and

A0B65B9F5DCB47DB981F450EAD76B27C.description: name symptoms of common illnesses and diseases;

B7FA3DB24A2D409180751DC0A74F2192.description: tell how germs cause illness and disease in people of all ages;

25E36A6B386D42F3B22B4DDF50069347.description: The student understands the difference between being sick and being healthy. The student is expected to:

3B8317CD643D4A7AB5E5253A03945CBA.description: explain the importance of health information.

724B460B19A04037B5F4D920AE791372.description: name people who can provide helpful health information such as parents, doctors, teachers, and nurses; and

B7D4410715CC4A8687FCD909AFC6DE03.description: The student understands how to recognize health information. The student is expected to:

476C8F677C504A1D9775D6BFE868A1C0.description: name and demonstrate good posture principles such as standing straight with shoulders back.

24F2D329E0C145D18AED85BA13D3B275.description: name major body parts and their functions; and

BF02D60D396C496EA028385D6480A32D.description: The student knows the basic structures and functions of the human body and how they relate to personal health. The student is expected to:

9C6B76CCB8B94038AD221893E175054E.description: plan a healthy meal and/or snack.

74AC9F5BD2974896B63773C0B020E4E4.description: demonstrate how to seek the help of parents/guardians and other trusted adults in making decisions and solving problems; and

877EDADD865745749F1CF4CB99828618.description: The student demonstrates decision-making skills for making health-promoting decisions. The student is expected to:

6062363E4F1141DD828464D3A413D039.description: name objects that may be dangerous such as knives, scissors, and screwdrivers and tell how they can be harmful.

CB1B0E8F28DE430FB19F28891D4B6E79.description: demonstrate procedures for responding to emergencies including dialing 911; and

3BE9B273C95C4788B908A5F16ADC69A3.description: identify how to get help from a parent and/or trusted adult when made to feel uncomfortable or unsafe by another person/adult;

5C3533A463794E5D85CFB6ACD65F8E42.description: practice safety rules during physical activity such as water safety and bike safety;

7706FE8B5D254C58AAEA475DEA8874C5.description: identify ways to avoid harming oneself or another person;

13A686950A3449A8B2FDE39592170492.description: name the harmful effects of tobacco, alcohol, and other drugs;

4882BFEDB7724C4D883D592FD5DA0423.description: identify safe and unsafe places to play such as a back yard and a street;

79B360686E4C4BAB989F42A6073DB839.description: identify the purpose of protective equipment such as a seat belt and a bicycle helmet;

DD516F552C95480ABFA3A7A6B1DE4586.description: The student understands that behaviors result in healthy or unhealthy conditions throughout the life span. The student is expected to:

E3BBBB8F6F15496E8335BC8DD3F689CA.description: identify types of exercise and active play that are good for the body.

A07190A7E1A94DBE8B8B2C978C169C44.description: identify types of foods that help the body grow such as healthy breakfast foods and snacks; and

D409A39B64D54E22AC7D8FB516F3988F.description: identify and practice personal health habits that help individuals stay healthy such as a proper amount of sleep and clean hands;

9370F4675BB64F28AB8C64AB902FFBE4.description: The student recognizes that personal health decisions and behaviors affect health throughout life. The student is expected to:
